channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The 32-year-old Colorado cowboy driving to the moon—and eventually Mars
item.description: In a Rye, Colorado, cattle pasture now subbing for the moon, an otherworldly vehicle bumps along a scrubby course of furrows and mounds, weaving aroun...

item.title: Activist investors are disproportionately targeting female CEOs—and it’s costing corporate America dearly
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: One High-Intensity Workout Craze Dominated 2025, New Report Finds
item.description: The ClassPass data reveals standout fitness trends from January to October.

item.title: The dangerous rise of the AI therapist
item.description: We were promised empathy in a box: a tireless digital companion that listens without judgment, available 24/7, and never sends a bill. The idea of AI ...

item.title: This Bill Gates-Backed Geothermal Startup Just Landed $462 Million
item.description: Fervo Energy uses hot underground rocks to create electricity. Google is also an investor.

item.title: Jerome Powell’s Outlook Is More Important Than the Actual Rate Cut
item.description: The Fed could lean either dovish or hawkish on its rate cut.

item.title: This Logistic Mistake Could Be the Most Expensive Business Decision You Make
item.description: There’s a hidden cost to going with the cheapest option.

item.title: 5 VCs sounds off on the AI question du jour
item.description: Who better to ask about a bubble than a group who will collectively deploy anywhere from tens to hundreds of millions of dollars over the next decade ...

item.title: This U.S. company’s new magnet could loosen China’s stranglehold on the supply chain
item.description: High-power magnets undergird an enormous amount of modern society. From high-end audio speakers to electric vehicles , wind turbines, and fighter jets...

item.title: Exclusive: U.S. businesses are getting throttled by the drop in tourism from Canada: ‘I can count the number of Canadian visitors on one hand’
item.description: Canadians traditionally make up the largest group of international tourists to the U.S.

item.title: Rashad Assir Is Making VCs Popular on TikTok. He’s Also Using His Own Platform to Speak Out
item.description: Assir is the satirical social voice of Redpoint Ventures, which has backed the founders of Stripe, Ramp, and Abridge. Since the war in Gaza began, he ...

item.title: Fed’s expected rate cut today is less about stimulating the economy and more about protecting the job market from ‘shattering’
item.description: A cut is something of an "insurance policy against a shattering of the U.S. labor market," UBS chief economist Paul Donovan said.

item.title: Inside tractor maker CNH’s push to bring more artificial intelligence to the farm
item.description: CNH CTO Jay Schroeder says using AI to improve farming is a decades-long passion. "I grew up on a family farm…so for me, it’s personal.”

item.title: Wheaties just put Timothée Chalamet on thousands of boxes. Would you buy one?
item.description: The front of the Wheaties box has served as a hall of fame for some of the greatest athletes of all time, from baseball star Lou Gehrig to boxer Muham...

item.title: Dropbox’s head designer is an AI optimist
item.description: AI is part and parcel of many corporate design processes these days, including one company making a product many creatives are familiar with: Dropbox ...
